data.question: What is the chemical formula of MAF-2?
At what temperature does MAF-2 start to decompose?
Is MAF-2 capable of adsorbing water?
What is the space group of MAF-2?
Does MAF-2 exhibit kinetically controlled flexibility?
What is the primary mechanism for gas sorption in MAF-2?
Can MAF-2 separate benzene from cyclohexane?
What is the yield range for synthesizing MAF-2?
data.answer: 80-100% depending on the solvent recovery ratio

data.question: What type of structural transformation does MAF-2 undergo upon MeCN adsorption?
Is the guest-free MAF-2 stable in air?
data.answer: True, but its color changes from white to light green depending on humidity

data.question: What is the role of ethyl groups in MAF-2's structure?
data.answer: They block the apertures of channels, acting as thermoactivated IRIS stops

data.question: What is the maximum temperature MAF-2 can withstand without structural change?
data.answer: Up to high temperature until decomposition above approximately 280 °C

data.question: Does MAF-2 adsorb N2 at 77 K?
What is the adsorption behavior of MAF-2 towards organic solvents and water?
data.answer: MAF-2 adsorbs large amounts of small organic molecules but excludes H2O

data.question: What is the symmetry of the MAF-2c phase?
Can MAF-2 adsorb supercritical N2 at 195 K?
What is the structural difference between MAF-2 and MAF-2c?
data.answer: MAF-2 has a distorted NbO type network without any symmetry-imposed disorder, unlike MAF-2c

data.question: What is the effect of temperature on MAF-2's N2 adsorption capacity?
data.answer: MAF-2's N2 adsorption capacity increases with temperature due to thermoactivated aperture opening

data.question: Does MAF-2 undergo permanent structural transformation upon sorption?
data.answer: False, the host framework is not altered upon N2 inclusion

data.question: What is the significance of MAF-2's multimode structural transformation ability?
data.answer: It allows MAF-2 to serve as a multipurpose guest sensor and actuator
